skill.description: Master advanced AgentDB features including QUIC synchronization, multi-database management, custom distance metrics, hybrid search, and distributed systems integration. Use when building distributed AI systems, multi-agent coordination, or advanced vector search applications.
skill.summary: Master advanced AgentDB features including QUIC synchronization, multi-database management, custom d...
skill.author: ruvnet

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only SKILL.md with educational content about AgentDB features. All static findings are FALSE POSITIVES: markdown backticks flagged as shell execution, mathematical terms (cosine, dot) flagged as weak crypto, and generic network terms flagged as C2 keywords. No executable code exists. The pre-existing skill-report.json correctly assessed this as 'safe' with no security risks.

content.user_title: Master Advanced AgentDB Vector Database Features
content.value_statement: Build sophisticated distributed AI systems with sub-millisecond synchronization and advanced search capabilities. Learn to implement QUIC sync, custom distance metrics, and hybrid vector plus metadata search for production applications.
actual_capabilities: Configure QUIC synchronization for sub-millisecond cross-node communication
Implement cosine, euclidean, and dot product distance metrics for vector similarity
Build hybrid searches combining vector similarity with metadata filters
Set up multi-database sharding for horizontal scaling across domains
Deploy production patterns with connection pooling and performance monitoring
limitations: Requires AgentDB v1.0.7 or higher and Node.js 18 or higher
QUIC synchronization needs proper network configuration and firewall access
Advanced distributed features require understanding of distributed systems concepts

use_cases.title: Distributed AI Agent Networks
use_cases.description: Build multi-agent systems with synchronized memory across nodes for collaborative AI applications.

use_cases.title: Hybrid Vector Search Systems
use_cases.description: Create advanced search engines combining semantic similarity with business metadata filtering.

use_cases.title: Production Vector Database Deployment
use_cases.description: Deploy and manage scalable vector databases with monitoring, pooling, and synchronization.

prompt_templates.title: Basic QUIC Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to set up AgentDB with QUIC sync between two servers at 192.168.1.10 and 192.168.1.11 on port 4433

prompt_templates.title: Hybrid Search Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a hybrid search for products that finds similar items vectorially but filters by price range 10 to 100 dollars and category electronics

prompt_templates.title: Custom Distance Metric
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a custom distance function that weights the first half of vector dimensions two times more than the second half

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Database Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a sharding strategy for AgentDB that separates data by domain including users, products, and orders with automatic routing

output_examples.input: Set up QUIC synchronization for three nodes
output: QUIC sync configured with sub-millisecond latency between nodes
Automatic retry and TLS 1.3 encryption enabled
Nodes discover and sync patterns automatically
Compression reduces network traffic by approximately 60 percent
Event broadcasting notifies all peers of changes

output_examples.input: Implement hybrid search for research papers
output: Hybrid search combines vector similarity with metadata filters
Filters include year greater than or equal to 2023 and category machine learning
Citation count filter finds highly cited papers
Results ranked by weighted combination of similarity and metadata score
Three separate database adapters created for different domains
Shard key extracted from domain prefix automatically
Default fallback shard handles unknown domains
Each shard maintains independent connection and query optimization

best_practices: Use connection pooling in production to avoid creating new adapters for each request
Implement proper error handling with exponential backoff for transient failures
Monitor query latency and set up alerts for performance degradation
anti_patterns: Do not expose QUIC ports directly to the internet without proper firewall rules
Avoid creating new database adapters for every operation - use pooling instead
Do not ignore dimension mismatch errors - they indicate data quality issues

faq.question: Is this compatible with standard AgentDB installations?
faq.answer: Yes, requires AgentDB v1.0.7 or higher via agentic-flow package. All features are backward compatible.

faq.question: What are the network requirements for QUIC sync?
faq.answer: UDP port 4433 must be open between peers. Works on local networks and VPNs.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing databases?
faq.answer: AgentDB is standalone but can complement existing databases. Use it for vector and pattern storage.

faq.question: How is data secured during synchronization?
faq.answer: QUIC uses TLS 1.3 encryption automatically. No additional configuration needed.

faq.question: What if QUIC sync fails between nodes?
faq.answer: Automatic retry with exponential backoff. Failed nodes catch up when reconnected.

faq.question: How does this compare to Pinecone or Weaviate?
faq.answer: AgentDB focuses on AI agent memory with reasoning capabilities, not just vector storage.
